description.narrative: 1) Enhancement of food security: The project will introduce a new supplier of a critical nutrient that is essential for improving farm productivity. This is expected to improve the supply in the regional ammonia market and therefore directly and/or indirectly help address the increasing challenges of affordable and sufficient food supply. 2) Local Value Addition and Creation of Export Revenues: The proposed project would contribute towards value addition taking place within Indonesia and create significant export revenues for Indonesia. 3) Job Creation and Community Development: The Project will create quality employment opportunities in the Central Sulawesi province of Indonesia. The Project is expected to create about 350 direct jobs during operation and 2,000 indirect jobs. Indirect jobs are expected to arise from opportunities created for local contractors engaged in regular maintenance and repair activities for the Project, transportation, food supply and other activities associated with the Project. In addition, the Company will provide social infrastructure and professional training to its personnel. 4) SME Development Impact: Chemical and petrochemical projects typically create a large number of downstream jobs and entrepreneurial opportunities in segments such as trading, logistics and transportation. The proposed Project is expected to have a significant multiplier effect through the creation and growth of supporting SME businesses.

PT Panca Amara Utama (PAU or the Company) is a private limited company that plans to set up a 2,000 metric tonnes per day greenfield ammonia production plant (the Project). The gas will be sourced from the Senoro-Toili gas fields in Central Sulawesi province of Indonesia. Key associated infrastructure for this project includes a pipeline to transport the gas to the plant and a jetty to supply the ammonia to buyers.
